channel.title: Optimization on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Optimization on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: 4+3 Phases of Compute-Optimal Neural Scaling Laws
item.description: Researchers discovered four distinct compute-optimal phases for training neural networks, offering new predictions for resource-efficient large model training.

item.title: A Combinatorial Algorithm for the Semi-Discrete Optimal Transport Problem
item.description: A new combinatorial algorithm dramatically speeds up semi-discrete optimal transport calculations, offering an efficient solution for large datasets and higher dimensions.

item.title: A Neural Network Approach for Efficiently Answering Most Probable Explanation Queries in Probabilistic Models
item.description: A novel neural network efficiently answers arbitrary Most Probable Explanation (MPE) queries in large probabilistic models, eliminating the need for slow inference algorithms.

item.title: A Primal-Dual-Assisted Penalty Approach to Bilevel Optimization with Coupled Constraints
item.description: BLOCC, a novel first-order algorithm, efficiently solves bilevel optimization problems with coupled constraints, offering improved scalability and convergence for machine learning applications.

item.title: A provable control of sensitivity of neural networks through a direct parameterization of the overall bi-Lipschitzness
item.description: New framework directly controls neural network sensitivity by precisely parameterizing overall bi-Lipschitzness, offering improved robustness and generalization.

item.title: A Separation in Heavy-Tailed Sampling: Gaussian vs. Stable Oracles for Proximal Samplers
item.description: Stable oracles outperform Gaussian oracles in high-accuracy heavy-tailed sampling, overcoming limitations of Gaussian-based proximal samplers.

item.title: A Simple and Adaptive Learning Rate for FTRL in Online Learning with Minimax Regret of Θ(T^{2/3}) and its Application to Best-of-Both-Worlds
item.description: A new adaptive learning rate for FTRL achieves minimax regret of O(T²/³) in online learning, improving existing best-of-both-worlds algorithms for various hard problems.

item.title: A Simple and Optimal Approach for Universal Online Learning with Gradient Variations
item.description: A novel universal online learning algorithm achieves optimal gradient-variation regret across diverse function curvatures, boasting efficiency with only one gradient query per round.

item.title: Accelerated Regularized Learning in Finite N-Person Games
item.description: Accelerated learning in games achieved! FTXL algorithm exponentially speeds up convergence to Nash equilibria in finite N-person games, even under limited feedback.

item.title: Accelerating ERM for data-driven algorithm design using output-sensitive techniques
item.description: Accelerating ERM for data-driven algorithm design using output-sensitive techniques achieves computationally efficient learning by scaling with the actual number of pieces in the dual loss function, n…

item.title: Accelerating Nash Equilibrium Convergence in Monte Carlo Settings Through Counterfactual Value Based Fictitious Play
item.description: MCCFVFP, a novel Monte Carlo-based algorithm, accelerates Nash equilibrium convergence in large-scale games by combining CFR’s counterfactual value calculations with fictitious play’s best response st…

item.title: Acceleration Exists! Optimization Problems When Oracle Can Only Compare Objective Function Values
item.description: Accelerated gradient-free optimization is achieved using only function value comparisons, significantly improving black-box optimization.

item.title: Adam with model exponential moving average is effective for nonconvex optimization
item.description: Clipped Adam with EMA achieves optimal convergence rates for smooth and non-smooth nonconvex optimization, particularly when scales vary across different coordinates.

item.title: Adaptive Proximal Gradient Method for Convex Optimization
item.description: Adaptive gradient descent methods are improved by leveraging local curvature information for entirely adaptive algorithms without added computational cost, proving convergence with only local Lipschit…

item.title: Adaptive Sampling for Efficient Softmax Approximation
item.description: AdaptiveSoftmax: Achieve 10x+ speedup in softmax computation via adaptive sampling!

item.title: Adaptive Variance Reduction for Stochastic Optimization under Weaker Assumptions
item.description: Adaptive STORM achieves optimal convergence rates for stochastic optimization of non-convex functions under weaker assumptions, eliminating the need for bounded gradients or function values and removi…

item.title: Almost Free: Self-concordance in Natural Exponential Families and an Application to Bandits
item.description: Generalized linear bandits with subexponential reward distributions are self-concordant, enabling second-order regret bounds free of exponential dependence on problem parameters.

item.title: An Accelerated Gradient Method for Convex Smooth Simple Bilevel Optimization
item.description: Accelerated Gradient Method for Bilevel Optimization (AGM-BiO) achieves state-of-the-art convergence rates for simple bilevel optimization problems, requiring fewer iterations than existing methods to…

item.title: An Improved Empirical Fisher Approximation for Natural Gradient Descent
item.description: Improved Empirical Fisher (iEF) approximation significantly boosts the performance of Natural Gradient Descent (NGD) optimizers, offering superior convergence and generalization.

item.title: Approximating the Top Eigenvector in Random Order Streams
item.description: Random-order stream data necessitates efficient top eigenvector approximation; this paper presents novel algorithms with improved space complexity, achieving near-optimal bounds.

item.title: Approximation-Aware Bayesian Optimization
item.description: Approximation-Aware Bayesian Optimization (AABO) boosts high-dimensional Bayesian optimization by jointly optimizing model approximation and data acquisition, achieving superior efficiency and perform…

item.title: Are Graph Neural Networks Optimal Approximation Algorithms?
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) learn optimal approximation algorithms for combinatorial optimization problems, achieving high-quality solutions for Max-Cut, Min-Vertex-Cover, and Max-3-SAT, while also p…

item.title: Asymptotics of Alpha-Divergence Variational Inference Algorithms with Exponential Families
item.description: This paper rigorously analyzes alpha-divergence variational inference, proving its convergence and providing convergence rates, thereby advancing the theoretical foundations of this increasingly impor…

item.title: Autobidder's Dilemma: Why More Sophisticated Autobidders Lead to Worse Auction Efficiency
item.description: More sophisticated autobidders surprisingly worsen online auction efficiency; a fine-grained analysis reveals that less powerful, uniform bidders lead to better market outcomes.

item.title: Automatic Outlier Rectification via Optimal Transport
item.description: This study presents a novel single-step outlier rectification method using optimal transport with a concave cost function, surpassing the limitations of conventional two-stage approaches by jointly op…

item.title: Average gradient outer product as a mechanism for deep neural collapse
item.description: Deep Neural Collapse (DNC) explained via Average Gradient Outer Product (AGOP).

item.title: Axioms for AI Alignment from Human Feedback
item.description: This paper revolutionizes AI alignment by applying social choice theory axioms to RLHF, exposing flaws in existing methods and proposing novel, axiomatically guaranteed reward learning rules.

item.title: Bandits with Preference Feedback: A Stackelberg Game Perspective
item.description: MAXMINLCB, a novel game-theoretic algorithm, efficiently solves bandit problems with preference feedback over continuous domains, providing anytime-valid, rate-optimal regret guarantees.

item.title: Barely Random Algorithms and Collective Metrical Task Systems
item.description: Randomness-efficient algorithms are developed for online decision making, requiring only 2log n random bits and achieving near-optimal competitiveness for metrical task systems.

item.title: Batched Energy-Entropy acquisition for Bayesian Optimization
item.description: BEEBO: a novel acquisition function for Bayesian Optimization, offering superior explore-exploit balance and handling large batches efficiently, even with noisy data.

item.title: Bayes-optimal learning of an extensive-width neural network from quadratically many samples
item.description: This study solves a key challenge in neural network learning, deriving a closed-form expression for the Bayes-optimal test error of extensive-width networks with quadratic activation functions from qu…

item.title: Bayesian Optimization of Functions over Node Subsets in Graphs
item.description: GraphComBO efficiently optimizes functions defined on node subsets within graphs using Bayesian Optimization. It tackles challenges posed by combinatorial complexity and computationally expensive fun…

item.title: Bayesian Strategic Classification
item.description: Learners can improve accuracy in strategic classification by selectively revealing partial classifier information to agents, strategically guiding agent behavior and maximizing accuracy.

item.title: Binary Search with Distributional Predictions
item.description: This paper presents a novel algorithm for binary search using distributional predictions, achieving optimal query complexity O(H(p) + log n) and demonstrating enhanced robustness against prediction er…

item.title: Boundary Decomposition for Nadir Objective Vector Estimation
item.description: BDNE: a novel boundary decomposition method accurately estimates the nadir objective vector in complex multi-objective optimization problems.

item.title: Challenges of Generating Structurally Diverse Graphs
item.description: Researchers developed novel algorithms to generate structurally diverse graphs, improving graph algorithm testing and neural network evaluation.

item.title: Collaboration! Towards Robust Neural Methods for Routing Problems
item.description: A novel Collaborative Neural Framework (CNF) enhances the robustness of neural vehicle routing methods against adversarial attacks by collaboratively training multiple models and intelligently distrib…

item.title: Communication Bounds for the Distributed Experts Problem
item.description: This paper presents communication-efficient protocols for the distributed experts problem, achieving near-optimal regret with theoretical and empirical validation.

item.title: Communication Efficient Distributed Training with Distributed Lion
item.description: Distributed Lion: Training large AI models efficiently by communicating only binary or low-precision vectors between workers and a server, significantly reducing communication costs and maintaining co…

item.title: Conformal Inverse Optimization
item.description: Conformal inverse optimization learns uncertainty sets for parameters in optimization models, then solves a robust optimization model for high-quality, human-aligned decisions.

item.title: Constrained Binary Decision Making
item.description: This paper presents a unified framework for solving binary statistical decision-making problems, enabling efficient derivation of optimal strategies for diverse applications like OOD detection and sel…

item.title: Constrained Sampling with Primal-Dual Langevin Monte Carlo
item.description: Constrained sampling made easy! Primal-Dual Langevin Monte Carlo efficiently samples from complex probability distributions while satisfying statistical constraints.

item.title: Contextual Decision-Making with Knapsacks Beyond the Worst Case
item.description: This work unveils a novel algorithm for contextual decision-making with knapsacks, achieving significantly improved regret bounds beyond worst-case scenarios, thereby offering a more practical and eff…

item.title: Contextual Linear Optimization with Bandit Feedback
item.description: This paper introduces induced empirical risk minimization for contextual linear optimization with bandit feedback, providing theoretical guarantees and computationally tractable solutions for improved…

item.title: Convergence of $ ext{log}(1/psilon)$ for Gradient-Based Algorithms in Zero-Sum Games without the Condition Number: A Smoothed Analysis
item.description: Gradient-based methods for solving large zero-sum games achieve polynomial smoothed complexity, demonstrating efficiency even in high-precision scenarios without condition number dependence.

item.title: Cost-aware Bayesian Optimization via the Pandora's Box Gittins Index
item.description: Cost-aware Bayesian optimization gets a boost with the Pandora’s Box Gittins Index, a novel acquisition function that efficiently balances exploration and exploitation while considering evaluation cos…

item.title: CSPG: Crossing Sparse Proximity Graphs for Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search
item.description: CSPG: a novel framework boosting Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search speed by 1.5-2x, using sparse proximity graphs and efficient two-staged search.

item.title: Decision-Focused Learning with Directional Gradients
item.description: New Perturbation Gradient losses connect expected decisions with directional derivatives, enabling Lipschitz continuous surrogates for predict-then-optimize, asymptotically yielding best-in-class poli…

item.title: Derandomizing Multi-Distribution Learning
item.description: Derandomizing multi-distribution learning is computationally hard, but a structural condition allows efficient black-box conversion of randomized predictors to deterministic ones.

item.title: Distributed Least Squares in Small Space via Sketching and Bias Reduction
item.description: Researchers developed a novel sparse sketching method for distributed least squares regression, achieving near-unbiased estimates with optimal space and time complexity.

item.title: Distribution Learning with Valid Outputs Beyond the Worst-Case
item.description: Generative models often produce invalid outputs; this work shows that ensuring validity is easier than expected when using log-loss and carefully selecting model classes and data distributions.

item.title: Distributional regression: CRPS-error bounds for model fitting, model selection and convex aggregation
item.description: This paper provides the first statistical learning guarantees for distributional regression using CRPS, offering concentration bounds for model fitting, selection, and convex aggregation, applicable t…

item.title: DistrictNet: Decision-aware learning for geographical districting
item.description: DISTRICTNET: A novel decision-aware learning approach drastically cuts geographical districting costs by integrating combinatorial optimization and graph neural networks.

item.title: Drago: Primal-Dual Coupled Variance Reduction for Faster Distributionally Robust Optimization
item.description: DRAGO: A novel primal-dual algorithm delivers faster, state-of-the-art convergence for distributionally robust optimization.

item.title: Efficient Combinatorial Optimization via Heat Diffusion
item.description: Heat Diffusion Optimization (HeO) framework efficiently solves combinatorial optimization problems by enabling information propagation through heat diffusion, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Efficient Graph Matching for Correlated Stochastic Block Models
item.description: Efficient algorithm achieves near-perfect graph matching in correlated stochastic block models, resolving a key open problem and enabling improved community detection.

item.title: Efficient Sign-Based Optimization: Accelerating Convergence via Variance Reduction
item.description: Sign-based optimization gets a speed boost! This paper introduces new algorithms that significantly accelerate convergence in distributed optimization by cleverly using variance reduction and enhanced…

item.title: Energy-Guided Continuous Entropic Barycenter Estimation for General Costs
item.description: New algorithm approximates continuous Entropic Optimal Transport (EOT) barycenters for any cost function, offering quality bounds and seamless EBM integration.

item.title: Entropy testing and its application to testing Bayesian networks
item.description: This paper presents near-optimal algorithms for entropy identity testing, significantly improving Bayesian network testing efficiency.

item.title: Entrywise error bounds for low-rank approximations of kernel matrices
item.description: This paper provides novel entrywise error bounds for low-rank kernel matrix approximations, showing how many data points are needed to get statistically consistent results for low-rank approximations.

item.title: Estimating Generalization Performance Along the Trajectory of Proximal SGD in Robust Regression
item.description: New consistent estimators precisely track generalization error during robust regression’s iterative model training, enabling optimal stopping iteration for minimized error.

item.title: Exact, Tractable Gauss-Newton Optimization in Deep Reversible Architectures Reveal Poor Generalization
item.description: Exact Gauss-Newton optimization in deep reversible networks surprisingly reveals poor generalization, despite faster training, challenging existing deep learning optimization theories.

item.title: Expectile Regularization for Fast and Accurate Training of Neural Optimal Transport
item.description: ENOT, a new Neural Optimal Transport training method, achieves 3x quality and 10x speed improvements by using expectile regularization to stabilize the learning process.

item.title: Exploring Jacobian Inexactness in Second-Order Methods for Variational Inequalities: Lower Bounds, Optimal Algorithms and Quasi-Newton Approximations
item.description: VIJI, a novel second-order algorithm, achieves optimal convergence rates for variational inequalities even with inexact Jacobian information, bridging the gap between theory and practice in machine le…

item.title: Fast Rates in Stochastic Online Convex Optimization by Exploiting the Curvature of Feasible Sets
item.description: This paper introduces a novel approach for fast rates in online convex optimization by exploiting the curvature of feasible sets, achieving logarithmic regret bounds under specific conditions.

item.title: Fast T2T: Optimization Consistency Speeds Up Diffusion-Based Training-to-Testing Solving for Combinatorial Optimization
item.description: Fast T2T: Optimization Consistency Boosts Diffusion-Based Combinatorial Optimization!

item.title: Faster Accelerated First-order Methods for Convex Optimization with Strongly Convex Function Constraints
item.description: Faster primal-dual algorithms achieve order-optimal complexity for convex optimization with strongly convex constraints, improving convergence rates and solving large-scale problems efficiently.

item.title: Feedback control guides credit assignment in recurrent neural networks
item.description: Brain-inspired recurrent neural networks learn efficiently by using feedback control to approximate optimal gradients, enabling rapid movement corrections and efficient adaptation to persistent errors…

item.title: First-Order Methods for Linearly Constrained Bilevel Optimization
item.description: First-order methods conquer linearly constrained bilevel optimization, achieving near-optimal convergence rates and enhancing high-dimensional applicability.

item.title: From Linear to Linearizable Optimization: A Novel Framework with Applications to Stationary and Non-stationary DR-submodular Optimization
item.description: A novel framework extends optimization algorithms from linear/quadratic functions to a broader class of ‘upper-linearizable’ functions, providing a unified approach for concave and DR-submodular optim…

item.title: FUGAL: Feature-fortified Unrestricted Graph Alignment
item.description: FUGAL: a groundbreaking graph alignment method surpassing state-of-the-art accuracy without compromising efficiency by directly aligning adjacency matrices.

item.title: Functionally Constrained Algorithm Solves Convex Simple Bilevel Problem
item.description: Near-optimal algorithms solve convex simple bilevel problems by reformulating them into functionally constrained problems, achieving near-optimal convergence rates.

item.title: Fundamental Convergence Analysis of Sharpness-Aware Minimization
item.description: This research establishes fundamental convergence properties for the widely-used SAM optimization algorithm, significantly advancing our theoretical understanding and practical applications.

item.title: General bounds on the quality of Bayesian coresets
item.description: New theoretical bounds on Bayesian coreset approximation errors enable efficient large-scale Bayesian inference, overcoming prior limitations and improving coreset construction methods.

item.title: Get rich quick: exact solutions reveal how unbalanced initializations promote rapid feature learning
item.description: Unbalanced initializations dramatically accelerate neural network feature learning by modifying the geometry of learning trajectories, enabling faster feature extraction and improved generalization.

item.title: Gliding over the Pareto Front with Uniform Designs
item.description: UMOD: a novel multi-objective optimization algorithm efficiently generates uniformly distributed Pareto-optimal solutions by maximizing minimal pairwise distances, providing high-quality representatio…

item.title: GLinSAT: The General Linear Satisfiability Neural Network Layer By Accelerated Gradient Descent
item.description: GLinSAT: A novel neural network layer efficiently solves general linear constraint satisfaction problems via accelerated gradient descent, enabling differentiable backpropagation and improved GPU perf…

item.title: Gradient Guidance for Diffusion Models: An Optimization Perspective
item.description: This paper provides a novel optimization framework for guided diffusion models, proving Õ(1/K) convergence for concave objective functions and demonstrating structure-preserving guidance.

item.title: Gradient Methods for Online DR-Submodular Maximization with Stochastic Long-Term Constraints
item.description: Novel gradient-based algorithms achieve O(√T) regret and O(T3/4) constraint violation for online DR-submodular maximization with stochastic long-term constraints.

item.title: Guided Trajectory Generation with Diffusion Models for Offline Model-based Optimization
item.description: GTG, a novel conditional generative modeling approach, leverages diffusion models to generate high-scoring design trajectories for offline model-based optimization, outperforming existing methods on b…

item.title: HardCore Generation: Generating Hard UNSAT Problems for Data Augmentation
item.description: HardCore: Fast generation of hard, realistic UNSAT problems for improved SAT solver runtime prediction.

item.title: High-probability complexity bounds for stochastic non-convex minimax optimization
item.description: First high-probability complexity guarantees for solving stochastic nonconvex minimax problems using a single-loop method are established.

item.title: How does Gradient Descent Learn Features --- A Local Analysis for Regularized Two-Layer Neural Networks
item.description: Neural networks learn features effectively through gradient descent, not just at the beginning, but also at the end of training, even with carefully regularized objectives.

item.title: Identification of Analytic Nonlinear Dynamical Systems with Non-asymptotic Guarantees
item.description: This paper proves that non-active exploration suffices for identifying linearly parameterized nonlinear systems with real-analytic features, providing non-asymptotic guarantees for least-squares and s…

item.title: Identifying Equivalent Training Dynamics
item.description: New framework uses Koopman operator theory to identify equivalent training dynamics in deep neural networks, enabling quantitative comparison of different architectures and optimization methods.

item.title: Implicit Bias of Mirror Flow on Separable Data
item.description: Mirror descent’s implicit bias on separable data is formally characterized, revealing convergence towards a maximum margin classifier determined by the potential’s ‘horizon function’.

item.title: Improved Guarantees for Fully Dynamic $k$-Center Clustering with Outliers in General Metric Spaces
item.description: A novel fully dynamic algorithm achieves a (4+ε)-approximate solution for the k-center clustering problem with outliers in general metric spaces, boasting an efficient update time.

item.title: Improved Regret for Bandit Convex Optimization with Delayed Feedback
item.description: A novel algorithm, D-FTBL, achieves improved regret bounds for bandit convex optimization with delayed feedback, tightly matching existing lower bounds in worst-case scenarios.

item.title: Improved Sample Complexity for Multiclass PAC Learning
item.description: This paper significantly improves our understanding of multiclass PAC learning by reducing the sample complexity gap and proposing two novel approaches to fully resolve the optimal sample complexity.

item.title: Incorporating Surrogate Gradient Norm to Improve Offline Optimization Techniques
item.description: IGNITE improves offline optimization by incorporating surrogate gradient norm to reduce model sharpness, boosting performance up to 9.6%

item.title: Inexact Augmented Lagrangian Methods for Conic Optimization: Quadratic Growth and Linear Convergence
item.description: This paper proves that inexact ALMs applied to SDPs achieve linear convergence for both primal and dual iterates, contingent solely on strict complementarity and a bounded solution set, thus resol…

item.title: Information-theoretic Limits of Online Classification with Noisy Labels
item.description: This paper unveils the information-theoretic limits of online classification with noisy labels, showing that the minimax risk is tightly characterized by the Hellinger gap of noisy label distributions…

item.title: Invariant subspaces and PCA in nearly matrix multiplication time
item.description: Generalized eigenvalue problems get solved in nearly matrix multiplication time, providing new, faster PCA algorithms!

item.title: Is Knowledge Power? On the (Im)possibility of Learning from Strategic Interactions
item.description: In strategic settings, repeated interactions alone may not enable uninformed players to achieve optimal outcomes, highlighting the persistent impact of information asymmetry.

item.title: Is Score Matching Suitable for Estimating Point Processes?
item.description: Weighted score matching offers a consistent, efficient solution for estimating parameters in point processes, overcoming the limitations of previous methods.

item.title: Iterative Methods via Locally Evolving Set Process
item.description: This paper proposes a novel framework, the locally evolving set process, to develop faster localized iterative methods for solving large-scale graph problems, achieving significant speedup over existi…

item.title: John Ellipsoids via Lazy Updates
item.description: Faster John ellipsoid computation achieved via lazy updates and fast matrix multiplication, improving efficiency and enabling low-space streaming algorithms.

item.title: Latent Neural Operator for Solving Forward and Inverse PDE Problems
item.description: Latent Neural Operator (LNO) dramatically improves solving PDEs by using a latent space, boosting accuracy and reducing computation costs.

item.title: Learning diffusion at lightspeed
item.description: JKOnet* learns diffusion processes at unprecedented speed and accuracy by directly minimizing a simple quadratic loss function, bypassing complex bilevel optimization problems.

item.title: Learning Elastic Costs to Shape Monge Displacements
item.description: Learn optimal transport maps with structured displacements using elastic costs and a novel bilevel loss function!

item.title: Learning Generalized Linear Programming Value Functions
item.description: Learn optimal LP values faster with a novel neural network method!

item.title: Learning Optimal Tax Design in Nonatomic Congestion Games
item.description: AI learns optimal taxes for congestion games, maximizing social welfare with limited feedback, via a novel algorithm.

item.title: Learning Social Welfare Functions
item.description: Learning social welfare functions from past decisions is possible! This paper shows how to efficiently learn power mean functions, a widely used family, using both cardinal and pairwise welfare compar…

item.title: Learning the Expected Core of Strictly Convex Stochastic Cooperative Games
item.description: A novel Common-Points-Picking algorithm efficiently learns stable reward allocations (expected core) in strictly convex stochastic cooperative games with unknown reward distributions, achieving high p…

item.title: Learning to compute Gröbner bases
item.description: AI learns to compute Gröbner bases, solving a notorious computational algebra problem efficiently via Transformers and novel algebraic techniques.

item.title: Learning to Handle Complex Constraints for Vehicle Routing Problems
item.description: Proactive Infeasibility Prevention (PIP) framework significantly improves neural methods for solving complex Vehicle Routing Problems by proactively preventing infeasible solutions and enhancing const…

item.title: Learning to Mitigate Externalities: the Coase Theorem with Hindsight Rationality
item.description: Economists learn to resolve externalities efficiently even when players lack perfect information, maximizing social welfare by leveraging bargaining and online learning.

item.title: Learning to Solve Quadratic Unconstrained Binary Optimization in a Classification Way
item.description: Researchers developed Value Classification Model (VCM), a neural solver that swiftly solves quadratic unconstrained binary optimization (QUBO) problems by directly generating solutions using a classif…

item.title: Learning-Augmented Approximation Algorithms for Maximum Cut and Related Problems
item.description: This paper shows how noisy predictions about optimal solutions can improve approximation algorithms for NP-hard problems like MAX-CUT, exceeding classical hardness bounds.

item.title: Learning-Augmented Dynamic Submodular Maximization
item.description: Leveraging predictions, this paper presents a novel algorithm for dynamic submodular maximization achieving significantly faster update times (O(poly(log n, log w, log k)) amortized) compared to exist…

item.title: Light Unbalanced Optimal Transport
item.description: LightUnbalancedOptimalTransport: A fast, theoretically-justified solver for continuous unbalanced optimal transport problems, enabling efficient analysis of large datasets with imbalanced classes.

item.title: Linear Transformers are Versatile In-Context Learners
item.description: Linear transformers surprisingly learn intricate optimization algorithms, even surpassing baselines on noisy regression problems, showcasing their unexpected learning capabilities.

item.title: Log-concave Sampling from a Convex Body with a Barrier: a Robust and Unified Dikin Walk
item.description: This paper introduces robust Dikin walks for log-concave sampling, achieving faster mixing times and lower iteration costs than existing methods, particularly for high-dimensional settings.

item.title: Lookback Prophet Inequalities
item.description: This paper enhances prophet inequalities by allowing lookback, improving competitive ratios and providing algorithms for diverse observation orders, thereby bridging theory and real-world online selec…

item.title: Loss Landscape Characterization of Neural Networks without Over-Parametrization
item.description: Deep learning optimization is revolutionized by a new function class, enabling convergence guarantees without over-parameterization and accommodating saddle points.

item.title: Low-Rank Optimal Transport through Factor Relaxation with Latent Coupling
item.description: FRLC: a novel algorithm for low-rank optimal transport using latent coupling, enabling faster computation and better interpretability for diverse applications.

item.title: Lower Bounds and Optimal Algorithms for Non-Smooth Convex Decentralized Optimization over Time-Varying Networks
item.description: First optimal algorithms matching lower bounds for non-smooth convex decentralized optimization over time-varying networks are presented, substantially improving theoretical performance.

item.title: Lower Bounds of Uniform Stability in Gradient-Based Bilevel Algorithms for Hyperparameter Optimization
item.description: This paper establishes tight lower bounds for the uniform stability of gradient-based bilevel programming algorithms used for hyperparameter optimization, resolving a key open problem regarding the ti…

item.title: Mean-Field Analysis for Learning Subspace-Sparse Polynomials with Gaussian Input
item.description: Researchers establish basis-free conditions for SGD learnability in two-layer neural networks learning subspace-sparse polynomials with Gaussian input, offering insights into training dynamics.

item.title: Mean-Field Langevin Dynamics for Signed Measures via a Bilevel Approach
item.description: This paper presents a novel bilevel approach to extend mean-field Langevin dynamics to solve convex optimization problems over signed measures, achieving stronger guarantees and faster convergence rat…

item.title: Mechanism design augmented with output advice
item.description: Mechanism design enhanced with output advice improves approximation guarantees by using imperfect predictions of the output, not agent types, offering robust, practical solutions.

item.title: Metric Transforms and Low Rank Representations of Kernels for Fast Attention
item.description: Researchers unveil novel linear-algebraic tools revealing the limits of fast attention, classifying positive definite kernels for Manhattan distance, and fully characterizing metric transforms for Man…

item.title: MILP-StuDio: MILP Instance Generation via Block Structure Decomposition
item.description: MILP-StuDio generates high-quality mixed-integer linear programming instances by preserving crucial block structures, significantly improving learning-based solver performance.

item.title: Minimum Entropy Coupling with Bottleneck
item.description: A novel lossy compression framework, Minimum Entropy Coupling with Bottleneck (MEC-B), extends existing methods by integrating a bottleneck for controlled stochasticity, enhancing performance in scen…

item.title: Mirror and Preconditioned Gradient Descent in Wasserstein Space
item.description: This paper presents novel mirror and preconditioned gradient descent algorithms for optimizing functionals over Wasserstein space, offering improved convergence and efficiency for various machine lear…

item.title: Motif-oriented influence maximization for viral marketing in large-scale social networks
item.description: Motif-oriented influence maximization tackles viral marketing’s challenge of reaching groups by proving a greedy algorithm with guaranteed approximation ratio and near-linear time complexity.

item.title: Multi-Label Learning with Stronger Consistency Guarantees
item.description: Novel surrogate losses with label-independent H-consistency bounds enable stronger guarantees for multi-label learning.

item.title: Multi-Winner Reconfiguration
item.description: This paper introduces a novel model for multi-winner reconfiguration, analyzing the computational complexity of transitioning between committees using four approval-based voting rules, demonstrating b…

item.title: Multiclass Transductive Online Learning
item.description: Unbounded label spaces conquered! New algorithm achieves optimal mistake bounds in multiclass transductive online learning.

item.title: Nature-Inspired Local Propagation
item.description: Inspired by nature, researchers introduce a novel spatiotemporal local algorithm for machine learning that outperforms backpropagation in online learning scenarios with limited data or long video stre…

item.title: Nearly Minimax Optimal Regret for Multinomial Logistic Bandit
item.description: This paper presents OFU-MNL+, a constant-time algorithm achieving nearly minimax optimal regret for contextual multinomial logistic bandits, closing the gap between existing upper and lower bounds.

item.title: Nearly Minimax Optimal Submodular Maximization with Bandit Feedback
item.description: This research establishes the first minimax optimal algorithm for submodular maximization with bandit feedback, achieving a regret bound matching the lower bound.

item.title: Nearly Optimal Approximation of Matrix Functions by the Lanczos Method
item.description: Lanczos-FA, a simple algorithm for approximating matrix functions, surprisingly outperforms newer methods; this paper proves its near-optimality for rational functions, explaining its practical succes…

item.title: Neur2BiLO: Neural Bilevel Optimization
item.description: NEUR2BILO: a neural network-based heuristic solves mixed-integer bilevel optimization problems extremely fast, achieving high-quality solutions for diverse applications.

item.title: Neural Combinatorial Optimization for Robust Routing Problem with Uncertain Travel Times
item.description: Neural networks efficiently solve robust routing problems with uncertain travel times, minimizing worst-case deviations from optimal routes under the min-max regret criterion.

item.title: Neural Pfaffians: Solving Many Many-Electron Schrödinger Equations
item.description: Neural Pfaffians revolutionize many-electron Schrödinger equation solutions by using fully learnable neural wave functions based on Pfaffians, achieving unprecedented accuracy and generalizability acr…

item.title: Newton Losses: Using Curvature Information for Learning with Differentiable Algorithms
item.description: Newton Losses enhance training of neural networks with complex objectives by using second-order information from loss functions, achieving significant performance gains.

item.title: No-regret Learning in Harmonic Games: Extrapolation in the Face of Conflicting Interests
item.description: Extrapolated FTRL ensures Nash equilibrium convergence in harmonic games, defying standard no-regret learning limitations.

item.title: Non-asymptotic Global Convergence Analysis of BFGS with the Armijo-Wolfe Line Search
item.description: BFGS algorithm achieves global linear and superlinear convergence rates with inexact Armijo-Wolfe line search, even without precise Hessian knowledge.

item.title: Non-geodesically-convex optimization in the Wasserstein space
item.description: A novel semi Forward-Backward Euler scheme provides convergence guarantees for non-geodesically-convex optimization in Wasserstein space, advancing both sampling and optimization.

item.title: On Convergence of Adam for Stochastic Optimization under Relaxed Assumptions
item.description: Adam optimizer achieves near-optimal convergence in non-convex scenarios with unbounded gradients and relaxed noise assumptions, improving its theoretical understanding and practical application.

item.title: On the Expressive Power of Tree-Structured Probabilistic Circuits
item.description: Tree-structured probabilistic circuits are surprisingly efficient: this paper proves a quasi-polynomial upper bound on their size, showing they’re almost as expressive as more complex DAG structures.

item.title: On the Optimal Time Complexities in Decentralized Stochastic Asynchronous Optimization
item.description: Fragile SGD & Amelie SGD achieve near-optimal speed in decentralized asynchronous optimization, handling diverse worker & communication speeds.

item.title: On the Sparsity of the Strong Lottery Ticket Hypothesis
item.description: Researchers rigorously prove the Strong Lottery Ticket Hypothesis, offering the first theoretical guarantees on the sparsity of winning neural network subnetworks.

item.title: One-Layer Transformer Provably Learns One-Nearest Neighbor In Context
item.description: One-layer transformers provably learn the one-nearest neighbor prediction rule, offering theoretical insights into their in-context learning capabilities.

item.title: Online Bayesian Persuasion Without a Clue
item.description: Researchers developed a novel online Bayesian persuasion algorithm that achieves sublinear regret without prior knowledge of the receiver or the state distribution, providing tight theoretical guarant…

item.title: Online Budgeted Matching with General Bids
item.description: MetaAd, a novel meta-algorithm, achieves provable competitive ratios for online budgeted matching with general bids, removing prior restrictive assumptions.

item.title: Online Consistency of the Nearest Neighbor Rule
item.description: The 1-nearest neighbor rule achieves online consistency under surprisingly broad conditions: measurable label functions and mild assumptions on instance generation in doubling metric spaces.

item.title: Online Convex Optimisation: The Optimal Switching Regret for all Segmentations Simultaneously
item.description: Algorithm RESET achieves optimal switching regret simultaneously across all segmentations, offering efficiency and parameter-free operation.

item.title: Online Estimation via Offline Estimation: An Information-Theoretic Framework
item.description: This paper introduces a novel information-theoretic framework, showing how to convert offline into online estimation algorithms efficiently, impacting interactive decision-making.

item.title: Online Learning of Delayed Choices
item.description: New algorithms conquer delayed feedback in online choice modeling, achieving optimal decision-making even with unknown customer preferences and delayed responses.

item.title: Online Weighted Paging with Unknown Weights
item.description: First algorithm for online weighted paging that learns page weights from samples, achieving optimal O(log k) competitiveness and sublinear regret.

item.title: Only Strict Saddles in the Energy Landscape of Predictive Coding Networks?
item.description: Predictive coding networks learn faster than backpropagation by changing the loss landscape’s geometry, making saddles easier to escape and improving robustness to vanishing gradients.

item.title: Optimal Algorithms for Augmented Testing of Discrete Distributions
item.description: Leveraging predictions, this research presents novel algorithms for uniformity, identity, and closeness testing of discrete distributions, achieving information-theoretically optimal sample complexity…

item.title: Optimal Algorithms for Learning Partitions with Faulty Oracles
item.description: Optimal algorithms for learning partitions are designed, achieving minimum query complexity even with up to l faulty oracle responses.

item.title: Optimal Algorithms for Online Convex Optimization with Adversarial Constraints
item.description: Optimal algorithms for online convex optimization with adversarial constraints are developed, achieving O(√T) regret and Õ(√T) constraint violation—a breakthrough in the field.

item.title: Optimal Hypothesis Selection in (Almost) Linear Time
item.description: This paper presents the first almost linear-time algorithm achieving the optimal accuracy parameter for hypothesis selection, solving a decades-long open problem.

item.title: Optimal Parallelization of Boosting
item.description: This paper closes the performance gap in parallel boosting algorithms by presenting improved lower bounds and a novel algorithm matching these bounds, settling the parallel complexity of sample-optima…

item.title: Optimization Algorithm Design via Electric Circuits
item.description: Design provably convergent optimization algorithms swiftly using electric circuit analogies; a novel methodology automating discretization for diverse algorithms.

item.title: Optimization Can Learn Johnson Lindenstrauss Embeddings
item.description: Optimization can learn optimal Johnson-Lindenstrauss embeddings, avoiding the limitations of randomized methods and achieving comparable theoretical guarantees.

item.title: Overcoming Brittleness in Pareto-Optimal Learning Augmented Algorithms
item.description: This research introduces a novel framework that overcomes the brittleness of Pareto-optimal learning-augmented algorithms by enforcing smoothness in performance using user-specified profiles and devel…

item.title: Parameter Symmetry and Noise Equilibrium of Stochastic Gradient Descent
item.description: SGD’s dynamics are precisely characterized by the interplay of noise and symmetry in loss functions, leading to unique, initialization-independent fixed points.

item.title: Parameter-free Clipped Gradient Descent Meets Polyak
item.description: Parameter-free optimization is revolutionized! Inexact Polyak Stepsize achieves the same convergence rate as clipped gradient descent but without any hyperparameter tuning, saving time and computatio…

item.title: Paths to Equilibrium in Games
item.description: In n-player games, a satisficing path always exists leading from any initial strategy profile to a Nash equilibrium by allowing unsatisfied players to explore suboptimal strategies.

item.title: Penalty-based Methods for Simple Bilevel Optimization under Hölderian Error Bounds
item.description: This paper proposes penalty-based methods for simple bilevel optimization, achieving (ε, εβ)-optimal solutions with improved complexity under Hölderian error bounds.

item.title: Piecewise-Stationary Bandits with Knapsacks
item.description: A novel inventory reserving algorithm achieves near-optimal performance for bandit problems with knapsacks in piecewise-stationary settings, offering a competitive ratio of O(log(nmax/min)).

item.title: Precise asymptotics of reweighted least-squares algorithms for linear diagonal networks
item.description: New analysis reveals how reweighted least-squares algorithms for linear diagonal networks achieve favorable performance in high-dimensional settings, improving upon existing theoretical guarantees and…

item.title: Pretrained Optimization Model for Zero-Shot Black Box Optimization
item.description: Pretrained Optimization Model (POM) excels at zero-shot black-box optimization, outperforming existing methods, especially in high dimensions, through direct application or few-shot fine-tuning.

item.title: Principled Bayesian Optimization in Collaboration with Human Experts
item.description: COBOL: a novel Bayesian Optimization algorithm leverages human expert advice via binary labels, achieving both fast convergence and robustness to noisy input, while guaranteeing minimal expert effort.

item.title: Provable Acceleration of Nesterov's Accelerated Gradient for Asymmetric Matrix Factorization and Linear Neural Networks
item.description: This paper proves Nesterov’s Accelerated Gradient achieves faster convergence for rectangular matrix factorization and linear neural networks, using a novel unbalanced initialization.

item.title: Proving Theorems Recursively
item.description: POETRY: a recursive neural theorem prover achieving 5.1% higher success rate and solving substantially longer proofs.

item.title: Putting Gale & Shapley to Work: Guaranteeing Stability Through Learning
item.description: Researchers improve two-sided matching market algorithms by prioritizing stability through novel bandit-learning algorithms, providing theoretical bounds on sample complexity and demonstrating intrigu…

item.title: Quadratic Quantum Variational Monte Carlo
item.description: Q2VMC, a novel quantum chemistry algorithm, drastically boosts the efficiency and accuracy of solving the Schrödinger equation using a quadratic update mechanism and neural network ansatzes.

item.title: Quantum Algorithms for Non-smooth Non-convex Optimization
item.description: Quantum algorithms achieve speedups in non-smooth, non-convex optimization, outperforming classical methods by a factor of ε⁻²/³ in query complexity for finding (δ,ε)-Goldstein stationary points.

item.title: Query-Efficient Correlation Clustering with Noisy Oracle
item.description: Novel algorithms for query-efficient correlation clustering with noisy oracles achieve a balance between query complexity and solution quality, offering theoretical guarantees and outperforming baseli…

item.title: Random Cycle Coding: Lossless Compression of Cluster Assignments via Bits-Back Coding
item.description: Random Cycle Coding (RCC) optimally compresses cluster assignments in large datasets, saving up to 70% storage in vector databases by eliminating the need for integer IDs.

item.title: Random Function Descent
item.description: Random Function Descent (RFD) replaces the classical convex function framework with a random function approach, providing a scalable gradient descent method with inherent scale invariance and a theore…

item.title: Randomized Strategic Facility Location with Predictions
item.description: Randomized strategies improve truthful learning-augmented mechanisms for strategic facility location, achieving better approximations than deterministic methods.

item.title: Reliable Learning of Halfspaces under Gaussian Marginals
item.description: New algorithm reliably learns Gaussian halfspaces with significantly improved sample and computational complexity compared to existing methods, offering strong computational separation from standard a…

item.title: ReLIZO: Sample Reusable Linear Interpolation-based Zeroth-order Optimization
item.description: ReLIZO boosts zeroth-order optimization by cleverly reusing past queries, drastically cutting computation costs while maintaining gradient estimation accuracy.

item.title: Rethinking Parity Check Enhanced Symmetry-Preserving Ansatz
item.description: Enhanced VQAs via Hamming Weight Preserving ansatz and parity checks achieve superior performance on quantum chemistry and combinatorial problems, showcasing quantum advantage potential in NISQ era.

item.title: RoPINN: Region Optimized Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: ROPINN: Revolutionizing Physics-Informed Neural Networks with Region Optimization

item.title: S-SOS: Stochastic Sum-Of-Squares for Parametric Polynomial Optimization
item.description: S-SOS: A new algorithm solves complex, parameterized polynomial problems with provable convergence, enabling efficient solutions for high-dimensional applications like sensor network localization.

item.title: Safe Exploitative Play with Untrusted Type Beliefs
item.description: This paper characterizes the fundamental tradeoff between trusting and distrusting learned type beliefs in games, establishing upper and lower bounds for optimal strategies in both normal-form and sto…

item.title: SAMPa: Sharpness-aware Minimization Parallelized
item.description: SAMPa: Parallelizing gradient computations in Sharpness-Aware Minimization (SAM) achieves a 2x speedup and superior generalization.

item.title: Sample Complexity of Algorithm Selection Using Neural Networks and Its Applications to Branch-and-Cut
item.description: Neural networks enhance algorithm selection in branch-and-cut, significantly reducing tree sizes and improving efficiency for mixed-integer optimization, as proven by rigorous theoretical bounds and e…

item.title: Sample Complexity of Posted Pricing for a Single Item
item.description: This paper reveals how many buyer samples are needed to set near-optimal posted prices for a single item, resolving a fundamental problem in online markets and offering both theoretical and practical …

item.title: Sample-efficient Bayesian Optimisation Using Known Invariances
item.description: Boost Bayesian Optimization’s efficiency by leveraging known invariances in objective functions for faster, more effective solutions.

item.title: Sample-Efficient Geometry Reconstruction from Euclidean Distances using Non-Convex Optimization
item.description: Reconstructing geometry from minimal Euclidean distance samples: A novel algorithm achieves state-of-the-art data efficiency with theoretical guarantees.

item.title: Scaling Laws in Linear Regression: Compute, Parameters, and Data
item.description: Deep learning’s neural scaling laws defy conventional wisdom; this paper uses infinite-dimensional linear regression to theoretically explain this phenomenon, showing that implicit regularization of S…

item.title: Semi-Random Matrix Completion via Flow-Based Adaptive Reweighting
item.description: New nearly-linear time algorithm achieves high-accuracy semi-random matrix completion, overcoming previous limitations on accuracy and noise tolerance.

item.title: Semidefinite Relaxations of the Gromov-Wasserstein Distance
item.description: This paper introduces a novel, tractable semidefinite program (SDP) relaxation for the Gromov-Wasserstein distance, enabling the computation of globally optimal transportation plans.

item.title: Sequential Probability Assignment with Contexts: Minimax Regret, Contextual Shtarkov Sums, and Contextual Normalized Maximum Likelihood
item.description: This paper introduces contextual Shtarkov sums, a new complexity measure characterizing minimax regret in sequential probability assignment with contexts, and derives the minimax optimal algorithm, co…

item.title: SGD vs GD: Rank Deficiency in Linear Networks
item.description: SGD surprisingly diminishes network rank, unlike GD, due to a repulsive force between eigenvalues, offering insights into deep learning generalization.

item.title: Shaping the distribution of neural responses with interneurons in a recurrent circuit model
item.description: Researchers developed a recurrent neural circuit model that efficiently transforms sensory signals into neural representations by dynamically adjusting interneuron connectivity and activation function…

item.title: Sharpness-Aware Minimization Activates the Interactive Teaching's Understanding and Optimization
item.description: Sharpness Reduction Interactive Teaching (SRIT) boosts interactive teaching’s performance by integrating SAM’s generalization capabilities, leading to improved model accuracy and generalization.

item.title: SkipPredict: When to Invest in Predictions for Scheduling
item.description: SkipPredict optimizes scheduling by prioritizing cheap predictions and using expensive ones only when necessary, achieving cost-effective performance.

item.title: Small coresets via negative dependence: DPPs, linear statistics, and concentration
item.description: DPPs create smaller, more accurate coresets than existing methods, improving machine learning efficiency without sacrificing accuracy.

item.title: Solving Inverse Problems via Diffusion Optimal Control
item.description: Revolutionizing inverse problem solving, this paper introduces diffusion optimal control, a novel framework converting signal recovery into a discrete optimal control problem, surpassing limitations o…

item.title: Statistical and Geometrical properties of the Kernel Kullback-Leibler divergence
item.description: Regularized Kernel Kullback-Leibler divergence solves the original KKL’s disjoint support limitation, enabling comparison of any probability distributions with a closed-form solution and efficient gra…

item.title: Statistical Estimation in the Spiked Tensor Model via the Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm
item.description: Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm (QAOA) achieves weak recovery in spiked tensor models matching classical methods, but with potential constant factor advantages for certain parameters.

item.title: Statistical-Computational Trade-offs for Density Estimation
item.description: Density estimation algorithms face inherent trade-offs: reducing sample needs often increases query time. This paper proves these trade-offs are fundamental, showing limits to how much improvement is…

item.title: Stochastic Optimal Control and Estimation with Multiplicative and Internal Noise
item.description: A novel algorithm significantly improves stochastic optimal control by accurately modeling sensorimotor noise, achieving substantially lower costs than current state-of-the-art solutions, particularly…

item.title: Stochastic Optimal Control Matching
item.description: Stochastic Optimal Control Matching (SOCM) significantly reduces errors in stochastic optimal control by learning a matching vector field using a novel iterative diffusion optimization technique.

item.title: Stochastic Zeroth-Order Optimization under Strongly Convexity and Lipschitz Hessian: Minimax Sample Complexity
item.description: Stochastic zeroth-order optimization of strongly convex functions with Lipschitz Hessian achieves optimal sample complexity, as proven by matching upper and lower bounds with a novel two-stage algorit…

item.title: Stopping Bayesian Optimization with Probabilistic Regret Bounds
item.description: This paper presents a novel probabilistic regret bound (PRB) framework for Bayesian optimization, replacing the traditional fixed-budget stopping rule with a criterion based on the probability of find…

item.title: Strategic Linear Contextual Bandits
item.description: Strategic agents gaming recommender systems is solved by a novel mechanism that incentivizes truthful behavior while minimizing regret, offering a solution to a key challenge in online learning.

item.title: SymILO: A Symmetry-Aware Learning Framework for Integer Linear Optimization
item.description: SymILO: A novel symmetry-aware learning framework dramatically improves integer linear program (ILP) solutions by addressing data variability caused by ILP symmetry.

item.title: Symmetries in Overparametrized Neural Networks: A Mean Field View
item.description: Overparametrized neural networks’ learning dynamics are analyzed under data symmetries using mean-field theory, revealing that data augmentation, feature averaging, and equivariant architectures asymp…

item.title: The Bayesian sampling in a canonical recurrent circuit with a diversity of inhibitory interneurons
item.description: Diverse inhibitory neurons in brain circuits enable faster Bayesian computation via Hamiltonian sampling.

item.title: The Empirical Impact of Neural Parameter Symmetries, or Lack Thereof
item.description: Breaking neural network parameter symmetries leads to faster training, better generalization, and improved loss landscape behavior, as demonstrated by novel asymmetric network architectures.

item.title: The Implicit Bias of Adam on Separable Data
item.description: Adam’s implicit bias revealed: On separable data, Adam converges towards the maximum l∞-margin solution, a finding contrasting with gradient descent’s l2-margin preference. This polynomial-time conver…

item.title: The Implicit Bias of Heterogeneity towards Invariance: A Study of Multi-Environment Matrix Sensing
item.description: Leveraging data heterogeneity, this study reveals that standard SGD implicitly learns invariant features across multiple environments, achieving robust generalization without explicit regularization.

item.title: The Many Faces of Optimal Weak-to-Strong Learning
item.description: A new, surprisingly simple boosting algorithm achieves provably optimal sample complexity and outperforms existing algorithms on large datasets.

item.title: The Minimax Rate of HSIC Estimation for Translation-Invariant Kernels
item.description: Researchers found the minimax optimal rate of HSIC estimation for translation-invariant kernels is O(n⁻¹/²), settling a two-decade-old open question and validating many existing HSIC estimators.

item.title: The Reliability of OKRidge Method in Solving Sparse Ridge Regression Problems
item.description: OKRidge’s reliability for solving sparse ridge regression problems is rigorously proven through theoretical error analysis, enhancing its applicability in machine learning.

item.title: The Road Less Scheduled
item.description: Revolutionizing machine learning, Schedule-Free optimization achieves state-of-the-art results without needing learning rate schedules, simplifying training and improving efficiency.

item.title: The Secretary Problem with Predicted Additive Gap
item.description: Beat the 1/e barrier in the secretary problem using only an additive gap prediction!

item.title: The Space Complexity of Approximating Logistic Loss
item.description: This paper proves fundamental space complexity lower bounds for approximating logistic loss, revealing that existing coreset constructions are surprisingly optimal.

item.title: Theoretical Characterisation of the Gauss Newton Conditioning in Neural Networks
item.description: New theoretical bounds reveal how neural network architecture impacts the Gauss-Newton matrix’s conditioning, paving the way for improved optimization.

item.title: Toward Global Convergence of Gradient EM for Over-Paramterized Gaussian Mixture Models
item.description: Gradient EM for over-parameterized Gaussian Mixture Models globally converges with a sublinear rate, solving a longstanding open problem in machine learning.

item.title: Trace is the Next AutoDiff: Generative Optimization with Rich Feedback, Execution Traces, and LLMs
item.description: Trace: Automating AI workflow design with LLMs.

item.title: Trade-Offs of Diagonal Fisher Information Matrix Estimators
item.description: This paper examines the trade-offs between two popular diagonal Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) estimators in neural networks, deriving variance bounds and highlighting the importance of considering e…

item.title: Trading off Consistency and Dimensionality of Convex Surrogates for Multiclass Classification
item.description: Researchers achieve a balance between accuracy and efficiency in multiclass classification by introducing partially consistent surrogate losses and novel methods.

item.title: Transductive Learning is Compact
item.description: Supervised learning’s sample complexity is compact: a hypothesis class is learnable if and only if all its finite projections are learnable, simplifying complexity analysis.

item.title: Truthfulness of Calibration Measures
item.description: Researchers developed Subsampled Smooth Calibration Error (SSCE), a new truthful calibration measure for sequential prediction, solving the problem of existing measures being easily gamed.

item.title: Understanding the Gains from Repeated Self-Distillation
item.description: Repeated self-distillation significantly reduces excess risk in linear regression, achieving up to a ’d’ factor improvement over single-step methods.

item.title: Universal Online Convex Optimization with $1$ Projection per Round
item.description: This paper introduces a novel universal online convex optimization algorithm needing only one projection per round, achieving optimal regret bounds for various function types, including general convex…

item.title: Universality of AdaGrad Stepsizes for Stochastic Optimization: Inexact Oracle, Acceleration and Variance Reduction
item.description: Adaptive gradient methods using AdaGrad stepsizes achieve optimal convergence rates for convex composite optimization problems, handling inexact oracles, acceleration, and variance reduction without n…

item.title: Unraveling the Gradient Descent Dynamics of Transformers
item.description: This paper reveals how large embedding dimensions and appropriate initialization guarantee convergence in Transformer training, highlighting Gaussian attention’s superior landscape over Softmax.

item.title: Unveiling User Satisfaction and Creator Productivity Trade-Offs in Recommendation Platforms
item.description: Recommendation algorithms on UGC platforms face a critical trade-off: prioritizing user satisfaction reduces creator engagement, jeopardizing long-term content diversity. This research introduces a ga…

item.title: User-Creator Feature Polarization in Recommender Systems with Dual Influence
item.description: Recommender systems, when influenced by both users and creators, inevitably polarize; however, prioritizing efficiency through methods like top-k truncation can surprisingly enhance diversity.

item.title: Validating Climate Models with Spherical Convolutional Wasserstein Distance
item.description: Researchers developed Spherical Convolutional Wasserstein Distance (SCWD) to more accurately validate climate models by considering spatial variability and local distributional differences.

item.title: Variance estimation in compound decision theory under boundedness
item.description: Unlocking the optimal variance estimation rate in compound decision theory under bounded means, this paper reveals a surprising (log log n/log n)² rate and introduces a rate-optimal cumulant-based est…

item.title: Warm-starting Push-Relabel
item.description: This research introduces the first theoretical guarantees for warm-starting the celebrated Push-Relabel network flow algorithm, improving its speed using a predicted flow, while maintaining worst-case…

item.title: What type of inference is planning?
item.description: Planning is redefined as a distinct inference type within a variational framework, enabling efficient approximate planning in complex environments.

item.title: When Is Inductive Inference Possible?
item.description: This paper provides a tight characterization of inductive inference, proving it’s possible if and only if the hypothesis class is a countable union of online learnable classes, resolving a long-standi…

item.title: Why Do We Need Weight Decay in Modern Deep Learning?
item.description: Weight decay’s role in modern deep learning is surprisingly multifaceted, impacting optimization dynamics rather than solely regularization, improving generalization and training stability.

item.title: Why the Metric Backbone Preserves Community Structure
item.description: Metric backbone graph sparsification surprisingly preserves community structure, offering an efficient and robust method for analyzing large networks.

item.title: Why Transformers Need Adam: A Hessian Perspective
item.description: Adam’s superiority over SGD in Transformer training is explained by the ‘block heterogeneity’ of the Hessian matrix, highlighting the need for adaptive learning rates.
